result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wallace Jerome Stinson

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Competency Report Dated 9/14/22

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson in court, in custody. Attorney Angel L Johnson in court for Wallace Jerome Stinson.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. Appearing by zoom is Dr. Deborah Collins. CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 36.  Case in court for competency hearing.  Parties stipulate to Dr. Deborah Collins qualifications to testify on this case.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. Deborah Collins.  Arguments heard.  
Court placed findings on the record, adopts the findings of Dr. Collins and finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant is committed on 8/23/2022 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Doctor's report.  Parties are contesting the Doctor's findings.  Court scheduled a hearing with Dr. Deborah Collins.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angel L Johnson in court, defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Doctor's Report.  Defense requests additional time to review report with defendant.  Court reschedules the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 38, Rm 635 CH.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Filed and forwarded to Judge for review.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
 Defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Wallace Jerome Stinson in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wallace Jerome Stinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.

K warrant
